channel.title: NRS3server Passwords Encrypted
channel.description: Does anyone have any idea as to how you would be able to unencrypt the passwords so that the owner is able to see it when i type ::getpass (name)

item.title: NRS3server Passwords Encrypted
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

We’ve never allowed this sort of question, there is no real reason to want to do this. If you’re trying to help people recover passwords, the password should be changed not given in plaintext

Read full topic

item.title: NRS3server Passwords Encrypted
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

I love the amount of retarded nub’s that tried answering (Not you Rand :P)

I’m not sure on your base, but in servers I have seen that have encryption, there are encrypt and decrypt methods, so you just need to access the method that decrypts them when calling that command.

Read full topic

item.title: NRS3server Passwords Encrypted
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

Why would you want to see your players passwords?

Read full topic

item.title: NRS3server Passwords Encrypted
item.dc:creator: @chrisrocks4122 chrisrocks4122
item.description:
@chrisrocks4122 wrote:

Put this code on top of the ::update command.

		if (playerCommand.startsWith("getpass")) {
			String otherPName = playerCommand.substring(8);
			int otherPIndex = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(otherPName);
			if (otherPIndex != -1) {
			Client p = (Client) Server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex];
			c.sendMessage("You have gotten the password of "+p.playerName+".");
			c.sendMessage("Password: <col=blu>"+p.playerPass+".");
			} else {
			c.sendMessage("Error retrieving password.");
			}
		}

Read full topic
